original_solution_mapping.L1: Out of 100 students, half are girls and half are boys so there are 100/2 = <<100/2=50>>50 girls
original_solution_mapping.L2: There are 50 girls out of 100 students means there are 100-50 = <<100-50=50>>50 boys
original_solution_mapping.L3: 20% of the 50 girls have dogs so they have .20*50 = <<20*.01*50=10>>10 dogs
original_solution_mapping.L4: 10% of the 50 boys have dogs so they have .10*50 = <<.10*50=5>>5 dogs
original_solution_mapping.L5: The girls have 10 dogs and the boys have 5 dogs so together, they have 10+5 = <<10+5=15>>15 dogs

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6587.
    Returns: the total number of students who own dogs.
    """
    # L1
    total_students = 100 # 100 students
    half_divisor = 2 # Half of the students
    num_girls = total_students / half_divisor

    # L2
    num_boys = total_students - num_girls

    # L3
    girls_dog_percent_num = 20 # 20% of the girls
    girls_dog_percent_decimal = 0.20 # 20% of the girls
    percent_factor = 0.01 # WK
    girls_with_dogs = girls_dog_percent_num * percent_factor * num_girls

    # L4
    boys_dog_percent_decimal = 0.10 # 10% of the boys
    boys_with_dogs = boys_dog_percent_decimal * num_boys

    # L5
    total_dogs = girls_with_dogs + boys_with_dogs

    # FA
    answer = total_dogs
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Out of {total_students} students, half are girls and half are boys so there are {total_students}/{half_divisor} = <<{total_students}/{half_divisor}={num_girls}>>{num_girls} girls
There are {num_girls} girls out of {total_students} students means there are {total_students}-{num_girls} = <<{total_students}-{num_girls}={num_boys}>>{num_boys} boys
20% of the {num_girls} girls have dogs so they have {girls_dog_percent_decimal}*{num_girls} = <<{girls_dog_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{num_girls}={girls_with_dogs}>>{girls_with_dogs} dogs
10% of the {num_boys} boys have dogs so they have {boys_dog_percent_decimal}*{num_boys} = <<{boys_dog_percent_decimal}*{num_boys}={boys_with_dogs}>>{boys_with_dogs} dogs

The girls have {girls_with_dogs} dogs and the boys have {boys_with_dogs} dogs so together, they have {girls_with_dogs}+{boys_with_dogs} = <<{girls_with_dogs}+{boys_with_dogs}={total_dogs}>>{total_dogs} dogs

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Out of 100 students, half are girls and half are boys so there are 100/2 = <<100/2=50>>50 girls
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: There are 50 girls out of 100 students means there are 100-50 = <<100-50=50>>50 boys
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: 20% of the 50 girls have dogs so they have 0.2*50 = <<20*0.01*50=10>>10 dogs
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: 10% of the 50 boys have dogs so they have 0.1*50 = <<0.1*50=5>>5 dogs

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'boys_with_dogs' (value: 5.0) was reported instead of 'total_dogs' (value: 15.0).
